ygData.subject: Re: Retreiving Corpse
ygData.msgSnippet: I pointed out to the GM that Meldrath was casting Charm through walls without ever having clear line of sight to me and told him I thought it was a bug.  The
ygData.messageBody:
I pointed out to the GM that Meldrath was casting Charm through walls without
ever having clear line of sight to me and told him I thought it was a bug. The
GM told me that it is NOT a bug and that there is nothing that can be done for a
player in this circumstance. Anyway, I have not found the GM's to be too helpful
and while it sucked for me at the time, I am more glad that they are not passing
out favors and goodies to every person that can think up a good story. Too many
people would abuse it.



Rodney Morris wrote:

> From: Rodney Morris <rodmorris@...>
>
> Roop Dirump wrote:
> > FYI, any monster casting a spell or charming through a wall is considered a
> > bug! So if you are charmed in this manner, you may petition to have
> > yourself resurrected. Do not rule out this option.
>
> *SNICKER*
> That's funny!
>
> OK, seriously though, I guess it is TECHNICALLY an option. But be
> warned - after losing my corpse due to a game bug, I petitioned, and
> a week and a day later I finally was contacted by a GM. Actually,
> that is not true - a friend of mine contacted a GM, as he is on for
> at least double the amount of time that I am.
>
> And if you are not contacted by the GM before your corpse decays,
> then it is GONE! No they can not, or maybe will not reimburse you
> for items you were carrying. Mino axe? gone. Magic armour? gone.
>
> Of course, you may be lucky and play during 'peak' times, when the
> concentration of GMs is likely to be higher. And I guess that the
> number of GMs has increased since my sad and sorry experience.
>
> Mully
> Veeshan
